title: The twins who tricked the Maya gods of death - Ilan Stavans

options.text: It was buried in a cave.

options.label: B
options.text: It was hung from a tree as a trophy.

options.label: C
options.text: It was thrown into a river.

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: C

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.text: A rite of passage from childhood to adulthood.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: A test of physical strength and endurance.

options.label: D
options.text: A demonstration of magical powers and abilities.

options.label: A
options.text: By exploring common themes and motifs, such as the struggle between good and evil.

options.label: B
options.text: By comparing the physical strength and abilities of the heroes.

options.label: C
options.text: By analyzing the historical and cultural context of the stories.

options.label: D
options.text: By evaluating the scientific and factual accuracy of the myths.

multiple-choice.question: What can the twins' journey be seen as a symbol for in the human experience?

options.label: A
options.text: The struggle for power and dominance.

options.label: B
options.text: The journey of self-discovery and transformation.

options.label: C
options.text: The overcoming of challenges and obstacles to achieve goals.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Whether good and evil are determined by physical strength and power.

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: D

title: The sleep disorder you might not know you have - Alayna Vaughan

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of people with obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) are estimated to be unaware they have it?
What is the primary cause of central sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: Blockages in the airway

options.label: B
options.text: The brain temporarily failing to regulate breathing

options.label: C
options.text: Larger tongues and thicker necks

options.label: D
options.text: Congestion and anatomical features

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They relax and narrow the airway

options.label: C
options.text: They expand and widen the airway

options.label: D
options.text: They remain unchanged

options.label: A
options.text: Reduced risk of cardiovascular disease

options.label: B
options.text: Lower blood pressure

options.label: C
options.text: Serious cardiovascular issues

options.label: D
options.text: Improved breathing during sleep

multiple-choice.question: What should a person experiencing loud, chronic snoring do to address potential health concerns?

options.label: A
options.text: Ignore the issue and hope it resolves itself

options.label: B
options.text: Consult a doctor to rule out obstructive sleep apnea (OSA)

options.label: C
options.text: Try to lose weight without consulting a doctor

options.label: D
options.text: Use a CPAP machine without consulting a doctor

multiple-choice.question: What is a potential solution for alleviating obstructive sleep apnea (OSA)?

options.label: A
options.text: Gaining weight

options.label: B
options.text: Limiting alcohol consumption before bed and elevating the head

options.label: C
options.text: Avoiding exercise and physical activity

options.label: D
options.text: Ignoring the condition and hoping it resolves itself

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between snoring and obstructive sleep apnea (OSA)?

options.label: A
options.text: Snoring is always caused by OSA

options.label: B
options.text: Snoring is never caused by OSA

options.label: C
options.text: Snoring can be a sign of OSA, but not all snoring is caused by OSA

options.label: D
options.text: OSA is always caused by snoring

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary difference between obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) and central sleep apnea?

options.label: A
options.text: OSA is caused by the brain's failure to regulate breathing, while central sleep apnea is caused by blockages in the airway

options.label: B
options.text: OSA is caused by blockages in the airway, while central sleep apnea is caused by the brain's failure to regulate breathing

options.label: C
options.text: OSA is more common than central sleep apnea

options.label: D
options.text: Central sleep apnea is more common than OSA

multiple-choice.question: What might be a comprehensive approach to treating obstructive sleep apnea (OSA)?

options.label: A
options.text: Using a CPAP machine alone

options.label: B
options.text: Losing weight alone

options.label: C
options.text: A combination of weight loss, behavioral shifts, and devices like CPAP machines

options.label: D
options.text: Ignoring the condition and hoping it resolves itself

options.label: A
options.text: So individuals can ignore the issue and hope it resolves itself

options.label: B
options.text: So individuals can take proactive steps to address potential sleep disorders

options.label: C
options.text: So individuals can use a CPAP machine without consulting a doctor

options.label: D
options.text: So individuals can try to lose weight without consulting a doctor

multiple-choice.question: What is a potential drawback of using CPAP machines to treat obstructive sleep apnea (OSA)?

options.label: A
options.text: They are too effective and may cure OSA too quickly

options.label: B
options.text: They may be uncomfortable to wear and can disrupt sleep patterns

options.label: C
options.text: They are too inexpensive and may not be taken seriously

options.label: D
options.text: They are only available for people with mild OSA

multiple-choice.question: Why is it crucial to address obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) as a critical health issue?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it can lead to serious cardiovascular issues if left untreated

options.label: B
options.text: Because it is a minor condition that can be ignored

options.label: C
options.text: Because it only affects older adults

options.label: D
options.text: Because it is only caused by blockages in the airway

options.label: B
options.text: University of Pennsylvania

options.label: C
options.text: Harvard University

options.label: D
options.text: Stanford University

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.text: Anger, bargaining, fear, depression, and hope

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: C

title: The secrets of the worldâ€™s most famous symphony - Hanako Sawada

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: B
options.text: It contributes to its memorability and emotional impact

options.label: C
options.text: It makes the music more predictable and less engaging

options.label: D
options.text: It reduces the emotional arc of the piece and creates a sense of resolution too early

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Experiment with new sounds and instrumentation, such as electronic elements, and push the boundaries of musical expression

options.label: C
options.text: Compose a piece with a single, unchanging melody and limited emotional arc

options.label: D
options.text: Write a piece that rejects the use of motifs and repetitive patterns

options.label: A
options.text: Use only traditional Classical instrumentation and follow established structures

options.label: B
options.text: Experiment with new sounds, instrumentation, and techniques to create a unique and expressive work

options.label: C
options.text: Compose a piece with a single, unchanging melody and limited emotional arc

options.label: D
options.text: Write a piece that rejects the use of motifs and repetitive patterns

options.label: A
options.text: Use the music to create a sense of calm and resolution throughout the film

options.label: B
options.text: Apply the dramatic and emotional arc of the symphony to key scenes and plot points to enhance the narrative

options.label: C

options.label: B

options.text: It combines Classical forms and structures with Romantic experimentation and expressiveness, creating a unique blend

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: The motif is used only once, at the beginning of the piece, and has no further impact

options.label: B
options.text: The motif is repeated and varied throughout the symphony, contributing to its emotional arc and dramatic tension

options.label: C
options.text: The motif is used only in the final movement of the symphony, creating a sense of resolution

options.label: D
options.text: The motif has no relation to the symphony's structure or emotional arc, serving only as a musical ornament

options.label: A
options.text: Only traditional Classical instrumentation, with no modern influences

options.label: B
options.text: A blend of electronic and acoustic elements, with a repetitive and varied motif, and a focus on experimentation and innovation

options.label: C
options.text: A single, unchanging melody played by a solo instrument, with no accompaniment or variation

options.label: D
options.text: A piece with no dramatic or emotional arc, focusing solely on musical texture and atmosphere

options.label: A
options.text: Only traditional Classical instrumentation, with no modern influences

options.label: B
options.text: A combination of electronic and acoustic elements, with a focus on experimentation, innovation, and expressive motifs

options.label: C
options.text: A single, unchanging melody played by a solo instrument, with no accompaniment or variation

options.label: D
options.text: A piece with no dramatic or emotional arc, focusing solely on musical texture and atmosphere

options.label: A
options.text: A single, static image with no movement or change, representing the motif in isolation

options.label: B
options.text: A dynamic and changing visual representation, with repeating and varying patterns, reflecting the motif's development throughout the symphony

options.label: C
options.text: A representation that uses only one color or shape, with no variation or contrast

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: Assess the significance of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony in the context of musical history. What is its importance?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a minor work with little influence on later music, serving only as a historical curiosity

options.label: B
options.text: It is a significant work that influenced the development of Classical music, but had limited impact on later styles

options.label: C

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: Evaluate the effectiveness of the "fate motif" in creating a sense of tension and drama in the symphony. What is its effect?

options.label: A
options.text: It creates a sense of boredom and stagnation, detracting from the music's emotional impact

options.label: B
options.text: It has no effect on the symphony's emotional arc, serving only as a musical ornament

options.label: C
options.text: It contributes to the symphony's sense of forward movement and drama, but is not the primary factor in creating tension

options.label: D
options.text: It is the primary factor in creating the symphony's sense of tension and drama, driving the music's emotional arc

title: The simplest math problem no one can solve

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the mathematical problem that states every positive integer will eventually end up in the 4, 2, 1 loop when applying the 3x+1 rules?

options.label: A
options.text: The Ulam Conjecture

options.label: B
options.text: The Collatz Conjecture

options.label: C
options.text: Kakutani's Problem

options.label: D
options.text: The Riemann Hypothesis

multiple-choice.question: What is the term used to describe the numbers obtained by applying the 3x+1 rules?

options.label: A
options.text: Hailstone numbers

options.label: B
options.text: Leading digits

options.label: C
options.text: Stopping time numbers

options.label: D
options.text: Coral numbers

options.label: A
options.text: To multiply an even number by 3 and add 1, and divide an odd number by 2

options.label: B
options.text: To multiply an odd number by 3 and add 1, and divide an even number by 2

options.label: C
options.text: To multiply all numbers by 3 and add 1

options.label: D
options.text: To divide all numbers by 2

options.label: B
options.text: They will eventually reach 0

options.label: C
options.text: They will eventually reach 1

options.label: D
options.text: They will eventually reach a random number

options.text: Number theory

options.label: B
options.text: Algebra

options.label: C
options.text: Geometry

options.label: D
options.text: Calculus

options.label: A
options.text: To demonstrate the limitations of mathematical knowledge

options.label: B
options.text: To prove the Riemann Hypothesis

options.label: C
options.text: To study the distribution of prime numbers

options.label: D
options.text: To develop a new mathematical formula

options.label: A
options.text: The halting problem

options.label: B
options.text: The traveling salesman problem

options.label: C
options.text: The Riemann Hypothesis

options.label: D
options.text: The P versus NP problem

options.label: B
options.text: Benford's Law

options.label: C
options.text: Fourier analysis

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and B

options.label: A
options.text: By creating new mathematical structures and patterns

options.label: B
options.text: By developing new mathematical formulas

options.label: C
options.text: By applying mathematical techniques to real-world problems

options.label: D
options.text: By proving existing mathematical theorems

multiple-choice.question: What is one way the Collatz Conjecture has been used in mathematical education and outreach?

options.label: A
options.text: To inspire new areas of mathematical research

options.label: B
options.text: To develop new mathematical curricula

options.label: C
options.text: To create interactive mathematical exhibits

options.label: D
options.text: To provide a simple example of an unsolved mathematical problem

multiple-choice.question: Why is the Collatz Conjecture considered a significant mathematical problem?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it has been solved

options.label: B
options.text: Because it has been studied for many years

options.label: C
options.text: Because it has important implications for mathematical research

options.label: D
options.text: Because it is a simple problem

options.label: B
options.text: It is too complex

options.text: It lacks progress and has limitations of mathematical knowledge

options.label: D

title: What few people know about the program that "saved" America - Meg Jacobs

options.text: One in four Americans

options.label: C
options.text: One in three Americans

options.label: D
options.text: One in two Americans

options.label: B

options.text: Unemployment rates increased slightly

options.label: C

options.text: Education and vocational training can be effective in preparing workers for new jobs

options.label: A
options.text: The New Deal's policies had no impact on unemployment rates

options.label: B
options.text: The New Deal's policies led to an immediate decrease in unemployment rates

options.label: C
options.text: The New Deal's policies contributed to a gradual decrease in unemployment rates

options.label: D
options.text: The New Deal's policies increased unemployment rates

multiple-choice.question: How did the New Deal's impact on Black communities vary?

options.label: A
options.text: The New Deal had a uniformly positive impact on Black communities

options.label: B
options.text: The New Deal had a uniformly negative impact on Black communities

options.label: C
options.text: The New Deal's impact on Black communities varied, with more positive effects in northern cities and less positive effects in southern cities

options.label: D
options.text: The New Deal had no impact on Black communities

multiple-choice.question: What critique can be made of the New Deal's impact on Black communities?

options.label: A
options.text: The New Deal had a uniformly positive impact on Black communities

options.label: B
options.text: The New Deal had a uniformly negative impact on Black communities

options.label: C
options.text: The New Deal's impact on Black communities was mixed, with some positive effects in northern cities and significant negative effects in southern cities

options.label: D
options.text: The New Deal had no impact on Black communities

multiple-choice.question: How effective was the New Deal in addressing the Great Depression?

options.label: A
options.text: The New Deal was completely ineffective in addressing the Great Depression

options.label: B
options.text: The New Deal was partially effective in addressing the Great Depression, but had significant limitations

options.label: C
options.text: The New Deal was highly effective in addressing the Great Depression, with no significant limitations

options.label: D
options.text: The New Deal had no impact on the Great Depression

multiple-choice.question: What new understanding can be formed by combining the New Deal's emphasis on education and vocational training with modern-day education policies?

options.label: A
options.text: Education and vocational training are not essential for workforce development

options.label: B
options.text: Education and vocational training should only be provided to certain groups

options.label: C
options.text: Education and vocational training can be effective in preparing workers for new jobs and should be a priority in modern-day education policies

options.label: D
options.text: Education and vocational training should be reduced in times of economic crisis

multiple-choice.question: What can be learned from the New Deal's approach to addressing economic crises, and how can it be applied to modern-day economic downturns?

options.label: A
options.text: Reducing government intervention in the economy is the most effective approach

options.label: B
options.text: Increasing taxes on wealthy Americans is the most effective approach

options.label: C
options.text: Implementing policies that support struggling citizens and invest in infrastructure projects is a key component of an effective approach

options.label: D
options.text: Reducing the national debt is the most effective approach

title: The epic of Gilgamesh, the king who tried to conquer death - Soraya Field Fiorio

multiple-choice.question: In what year was the Epic of Gilgamesh discovered in the ancient city of Nineveh in northern Iraq?
Who created Enkidu to tame Gilgamesh?

options.label: A
options.text: The goddess Ishtar

options.label: B
options.text: The goddess Aruru

options.label: C
options.text: The god Enlil

options.label: D
options.text: The god Shamash

multiple-choice.question: What is the central theme of the Epic of Gilgamesh?

options.label: A
options.text: The struggle between good and evil

options.label: B
options.text: The power of the gods and goddesses

options.label: C
options.text: A king's journey to self-discovery and acceptance of mortality

options.label: D
options.text: The importance of friendship and companionship in shaping one's identity

multiple-choice.question: How does Gilgamesh change throughout the story?

options.label: A
options.text: He becomes more selfish and tyrannical

options.label: B
options.text: He becomes more focused on his own mortality and personal growth

options.label: C
options.text: He becomes more aggressive and violent in his pursuit of power

options.label: D
options.text: He remains unchanged, refusing to learn from his experiences

multiple-choice.question: What is one way the story of Gilgamesh can be applied to modern-day issues?

options.label: A
options.text: It can be used to justify war and aggression

options.label: B
options.text: It can be used to explore the human quest for immortality and the importance of friendship

options.label: C
options.text: It can be used to promote a patriarchal society and reinforce traditional gender roles

options.label: D
options.text: It can be used to examine the human condition and the search for meaning and purpose in life

multiple-choice.question: How can the themes of the Epic of Gilgamesh be applied to individual lives and experiences?

options.label: A
options.text: By promoting selfishness and aggression as means to achieve success

options.label: B
options.text: By encouraging self-discovery and personal growth through introspection and friendship

options.label: C
options.text: By justifying the pursuit of wealth and power at any cost

options.label: D
options.text: By promoting a life of isolation and withdrawal from society

multiple-choice.question: What is the central theme of the relationship between Gilgamesh and Enkidu?

options.label: A
options.text: The importance of war and conquest in shaping their bond

options.label: B
options.text: The power of the gods and goddesses in controlling their fate

options.label: C
options.text: The transformative power of friendship and companionship in shaping their identities

options.label: D
options.text: The struggle between good and evil as embodied by their contrasting personalities

multiple-choice.question: What is the cause-and-effect connection between Enkidu's death and Gilgamesh's actions?

options.label: A
options.text: Gilgamesh becomes more selfish and tyrannical after Enkidu's death

options.label: B
options.text: Gilgamesh becomes more aggressive and violent in his pursuit of power after Enkidu's death

options.label: C
options.text: Gilgamesh sets out on a quest for immortality after Enkidu's death, driven by fear and grief

options.label: D
options.text: Gilgamesh becomes more focused on his own mortality and personal growth, leading to a journey of self-discovery

multiple-choice.question: How can the Epic of Gilgamesh be seen in relation to other works of literature?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a completely original work with no influence from other literature

options.label: B
options.text: It is a precursor to modern-day literature, influencing works such as Homer's Odyssey and the Bible

options.label: C
options.text: It is a direct copy of other ancient Mesopotamian literature, lacking originality and creativity

options.label: D
options.text: It is a critique of ancient Mesopotamian culture and society, offering a unique perspective on the time period

multiple-choice.question: How can the character of Gilgamesh be seen in relation to the human condition?

options.label: A
options.text: He represents only the flaws of humanity, embodying the worst aspects of human nature

options.label: B
options.text: He represents only the potential of humanity, exemplifying the best aspects of human nature

options.label: C
options.text: He represents both the flaws and the potential of humanity, making him a relatable and complex character

options.label: D
options.text: He represents neither the flaws nor the potential of humanity, existing outside the bounds of human experience

multiple-choice.question: How can the Epic of Gilgamesh be evaluated as a work of literature?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a poorly written and unengaging story, lacking literary merit

options.label: B
options.text: It is a well-written and engaging story that explores universal themes and the human condition

options.label: C
options.text: It is a historically significant work, offering insights into ancient Mesopotamian culture and society

options.label: D
options.text: It is a work of mythology, lacking historical accuracy and cultural relevance

multiple-choice.question: What is one potential critique of the Epic of Gilgamesh?

options.label: A
options.text: Its portrayal of women is too positive and empowering, contradicting the societal attitudes of the time

options.label: B
options.text: Its portrayal of women, particularly the goddess Ishtar, is patriarchal and biased, reflecting the societal attitudes of the time

options.label: C
options.text: Its use of violence and aggression is too limited and restrained, failing to accurately depict the brutality of ancient warfare

options.label: D
options.text: Its exploration of the human condition is too superficial and lacking in depth, failing to offer meaningful insights into human nature
